title: How to Make Baked Red Peppers Stuffed With Spinach, Shallots and Fresh Sage

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C).
Heat 1 Tbsp.of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the spinach, cover, and cook for 2 to 3 minutes, until just wilted.
Remove and drain in a colander.
Press excess liquid out, then finely chop.
Reserve the chopped spinach in a small bowl until needed.
Put the halved bell peppers on a rack to steam over rapidly boiling water.
Cover and steam approximately 10 minutes, until softened.
Place steamed bell peppers on a plate and set aside.
Heat the remaining olive oil in a clean, large skillet over medium heat.
Add shallots.
Add sage, stir, and cook for 1 to 2 minutes.
Remove skillet from heat.
Combine spinach, shallot and sage, 4 tbsp.
steps.description: pecorino cheese and ground black pepper.

steps.headline: Mix with a wooden spoon.
steps.description: Divide the mixture into the warm red pepper halves.

steps.headline: Sprinkle remaining cheese over the bell peppers.
Put the peppers in a small baking dish, then pour water into the bottom.
Bake the peppers 25 to 30 minutes until they are tender.
Transfer to individual serving plates and serve hot or at room temperature.
Finished.

text: Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  Heat 1 Tbsp.of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.  Add the spinach, cover, and cook for 2 to 3 minutes, until just wilted.  Remove and drain in a colander.  Press excess liquid out, then finely chop.  Reserve the chopped spinach in a small bowl until needed.  Put the halved bell peppers on a rack to steam over rapidly boiling water.  Cover and steam approximately 10 minutes, until softened.  Place steamed bell peppers on a plate and set aside.  Heat the remaining olive oil in a clean, large skillet over medium heat.  Add shallots. Cook until soft and translucent. Add sage, stir, and cook for 1 to 2 minutes.  Remove skillet from heat.  Combine spinach, shallot and sage, 4 tbsp. pecorino cheese and ground black pepper. Mix with a wooden spoon. Divide the mixture into the warm red pepper halves. Sprinkle remaining cheese over the bell peppers.  Put the peppers in a small baking dish, then pour water into the bottom.  Bake the peppers 25 to 30 minutes until they are tender.  Transfer to individual serving plates and serve hot or at room temperature.  Finished.
